BE it enacted by the Queens Most Excellent Majesty,

Establishment, Objects and Powers of the Council.
2, (1) There shall be established a council called etablishmene
the National Youth Servics Council (hereinafter in ne
this Act referred to as the Council) consisting C-
of the persons who are for the time being members
of the Council under section 7.
(| The objects for which the Council is established
are hereby declared to be, in particalar, to formulate
schemes of voluntary national service for youths, and
to carry out euch schemes either by itself or through
approved institutions, and in general,
(@) to fester among persons in, Ceylon in. general
and smong the youth of Ceylon in particular,
a spirit of national consciousness, a sense of
discipline, an awareness of social and
economic problems and a sense of the dignity
of labour;
(8) to enlist the continuous and active participation
of the youth of Ceylon without regard to
clasa or rece or religion, in national
development schemes by means of all forms
of voluntary service;
() to organize and implement on a voluntary basis
national service projects of every description
and, in particular, projects direoted
towards social welfare, social rehabilitation
and the economic development of Ceylon; {
2 Voluntary National Youth Service Act,
: (@ to assist bodies of persons in carrying out
: national progremmnes, of | public utitity,
i social welfare, social rehabilitation and
! economic development; ;
: (2 to provide a constant employment opportunity
' for youths by constructively investing
} Government funds on a long-term policy
basis aimed to strengthen the economic
Hy fabric of the State;
: (Pt conduct vocational training of highly
efficient and well disciplined laymen
and semi-skilled workers for industry,
agriculture and other services; and
(g) promote goodwill and mutual understanding
. ween Ceylon and other countries by
organizing the exchange of youths who
volunteer to assist in projects of national
service.
(8) In this Act, approved institution moans
7 any institution or any class of institutions, whether
educational or otherwise, which is approved for the
purpose of this Act by the Minister by Order
published in the Gazetie.

Provided, however, that no donation shall be

Ceylon until a detailed description of the donation is
placed before the House of Representatives. .
